intro: Lasiorrhiza hahnii, commonly known as the Hahn's beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from purple to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. Lasiorrhiza hahnii is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral.
